review: Love our Fire TV on the living room TV, thought about getting more but then Amazon came up with the Fire TV Stick and we bought these for our boys room TVs.  They are a great alternative for there use.Recommend both the Fire TV Stick and Fire TV.  Both have there strengths, so pick the right one for each of you TVs.The Fire TV sticks allow for most Fire TV games and the streaming video is great.For voice control use the Fire TV Android app on your phone or Kindle Frre.I do recommend you make sure you have good WiFI, especially when running multiple streaming devices.  My one son's room was on the edge of our old WiFi set up.  Just upgraded to a Linksys WRT-1900AC works great with Cat 7 cables to the main router.  The With all our Kindles,the Fire TV, Fire TV sticks and laptops you need the bandwidth.Thankfully, Amazon has everything needed.
author: K. Kirschke

review: Especially for Amazon prime, this is a great unit.  Granted, I got it for $20, but it compares well with my Roku units in terms of picture quality, useability, and selection.  The only thing missing is HBO Go.  Setup was easy, even considering my household wireless is a non-standard, non-broadcasting SSID.  Most of the negative reviews are the result, I believe, of not using the included micro USB power supply.  If you look at the power supply, you may notice that it has a 1 amp output.  Most TVs (or computers, for that matter) output 500 mA (1/2 A), the USB standard, if they have a USB plug at all.  The Fire Stick needs more, much like an iPad or an Android tablet.  Users - don't get stupid on the power.  And if you do, don't post a negative review.  RTFM.
